pairs <math alttext="open parentheses x comma y close parentheses"><semantics><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfenced><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. Which of the following is true about the nature of the data?

choices.label: The <math alttext="y"><semantics><mi>y</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>-values demonstrate a common ratio of <math alttext="1.094"><semantics><mn>1.094</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> because an exponential regression using the data gives <math alttext="1.094"><semantics><mn>1.094</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> as a base value.

​A common ratio of the <math alttext="y"><semantics><mi>y</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>-values can be found as <math alttext="1.075"><semantics><mn>1.075</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> because <math alttext="fraction numerator 10.750 over denominator 10.000 end fraction equals 1.075"><semantics><mrow><mfrac><mn>10.750</mn><mn>10.000</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>1.075</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>.

​A common ratio of the <math alttext="y"><semantics><mi>y</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>-values can be found as <math alttext="1.25"><semantics><mn>1.25</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> after subtracting <math alttext="7"><semantics><mn>7</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> from each <math alttext="y"><semantics><mi>y</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>-value.

​The <math alttext="y"><semantics><mi>y</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>-values do not have a common ratio, so an exponential function cannot be used in modeling the data.

content.answer: ​A common ratio of the <math alttext="y"><semantics><mi>y</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>-values can be found as <math alttext="1.25"><semantics><mn>1.25</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> after subtracting <math alttext="7"><semantics><mn>7</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> from each <math alttext="y"><semantics><mi>y</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>-value.
